meanings.definition: A type of lively French dance.
meanings.sent1: During the party, everyone joined in the cotillons and danced joyfully.
meanings.sent2: The cotillons at the ball were elegant and full of energy.
meanings.sent3: The cotillons dance made everyone smile and clap along.
meanings.sent4: Her movements on the dance floor were as graceful as a flock of cotillons.
meanings.sent5: The music for the cotillons was so catchy, it stayed in my head all night.

meanings.sent1: The children were amazed by the bright sparks from the cotillons in the sky.
meanings.sent2: We lit up the night sky with colorful cotillons during the celebration.
meanings.sent3: The cotillons fireworks added a magical touch to the event.
meanings.sent4: The cotillons sparkled like tiny stars in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the cotillons crackling filled the air with excitement.

meanings.definition: A type of fancy paper decoration used in celebrations.
meanings.sent1: The room was adorned with beautiful cotillons hanging from the ceiling.
meanings.sent2: Guests were delighted by the intricate designs of the cotillons at the party.
meanings.sent3: The cotillons decorations fluttered gently in the breeze, adding charm to the occasion.
meanings.sent4: Her gift was wrapped in layers of colorful cotillons, making it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The cotillons swayed gracefully, reflecting the light and creating a festive atmosphere.
